title: Napton Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: David P Howard / Napton reservoir
images.caption: View east across Napton reservoir when it used to be home to AP Sailing Club in 1978. A narrowboat can be seen in the background on the Grand Union Canal, having just left Calcutt Locks heading for Napton Junction and the Oxford Canal.

images.title: Andy F / Ice-free pool under the footbridge at Napton reservoir
images.caption: Ice-free pool under the footbridge at the lake during the winter of 2010

description: This walk visits Napton Reservoir near the village of Napton on the Hill in Warwickshire. The lake is a good place for fishing and an easy stroll. There's a car park on the western side of the water where you can pick up footpaths running along the lake. Follow the paths north and they will take you to Calcutt Marina and lock on the Grand Union Canal . You can extend your walk by heading south and picking up the Oxford Canal Walk .
